==Translingual==

===Etymology===
A door ([[門]]) opened to spring. Cognate to [[丣]], from whence also top of [[留]].

==Chinese==
{{zh-forms}}

===Glyph origin===
{{Han etym}}

This character was found in oracle bone scripts depicting a sacrifice (a human or animal body) that is cut in half. This kind of practice mainly happened in [[w:Shang dynasty|Shang dynasty]] and was gradually eliminated after [[w:Zhou dynasty|Zhou]]'s conquest of Shang, leading to obscurity of the character's original meaning.
